item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

quest rs:

Does it really matter which way you use? like would it affect the memory use? Also how would it compare to math.ceil or floor (compared in memory only, if any difference)?

Not significantly, if at all. That shouldn’t be a concern

item.title: Pick random word from a string
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:8, topic:205919”][quote author=supamagier link=topic=271647.msg2227154#msg2227154 date=1210938696]
but why use Math.round() anyway?
[/quote]

Because there’s no such thing as someArray[1.43]

Or did you mean, why not just cast to int? Because I like Math.round(). :)[/quote]
[s]

that’s confusing… Now i’m curious ( sorry no intentions of thread hijacking but since the questions is relevant…)

Does it really matter which way you use? like would it affect the memory use? Also how would it compare to math.ceil or floor (compared in memory only, if any difference)?[/s]

ignore it all, i guess i’ll rather go without knowing that than risking getting flamed :P… time to google!

item.title: Pick random word from a string
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

yeah, why would you add .5?

It will work but there is a rare chance of the number being .5 above the index which would result in array out of bound exception as k00dr stated.

Read full topic
item.source: Pick random word from a string

item.title: Pick random word from a string
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:4, topic:205919”]Yup that about sums it up, what VB7 says. Although I would have use (int)((Math.random()*possible.length)+.5)
I don’t think it differs, but i could be wrong[/quote]
You are indeed wrong, because in this case rounding (+0.5) would give you a too high index for the array.

Read full topic

item.title: Pick random word from a string
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

String[] possible = {“Put”, “possible”, “words”, “here”, “separated”, “by”, “commas”};

String password = possible[(int)(Math.round(Math.random() * possible.length))];

item.title: Pick random word from a string
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

How would i get it so that this string: String password = “swordfish”; Has multiple words in it and I can get my program to pick one fo the words at random, I have this atm.

[code=java]import javax.swing.JTextField;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class MyActionListener implements ActionListener {

JTextField textfield;
JFrame frame;
Scanner myScanner = new Scanner(System.in);
String password = "swordfish";
String userInput;

MyActionListener(JTextField textfield) {
	this.textfield = textfield;
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
if (password.equalsIgnoreCase(textfield.getText()) && Guess <= 9 && Guess >= 0) {
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, “CORRECT! Putting guesses back to 10.”);
Guess = 10;
} else {
Guess -= 1;
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "WRONG! Tries left: "+Guess);
}
if (Guess <= 0) {
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, “Sorry, you use up all your tries. Game is being reset”);
Guess = 10;
}
}
public int Guess = 10;
}[/code]

Thanks.

Read full topic
